resources.string: I am an ambitious and motivated software developer with a bachelor\'s degree in Computer Science and a minor in Management Information Systems from Pennsylvania State University. Additionally, I was a resident assistant and a grader/TA, as well as an active member of multiple clubs and organizations on campus. I have built multiple Android applications and this portfolio app \"from the ground up.\" I am actively seeking full time employment in the Software Engineering/Development field.
I love building, designing, reading, & cracking logic puzzles.

• Worked with a team of 5 hackers to build a facial recognition web interface and an android app for Capital One in order to accelerate the deposit/withdrawal process. \n\n• Analyzed a multitude of the real public-facing data provided by the Nessie API in order to create an ”on the go” banking experience for Capital One customers.

• Built a multi-screen app using intents, external libraries, interfaces, and custom classes that enables users to learn Sanskrit words, numbers, phrases, and colors.\n\n • Each of the categories are implemented using ListView and Custom ArrayAdapters that recycles views to enhance response time.
• Built an app using intents, interfaces, and custom classes that enables users to email custom order information to the person buying the goods.

• Implemented a web application which pulls project/organization data from Git-Hub and analyzes it using machine learning.\n\n • The analyzed data isused to evaluate team members placed on a project, based on their performance statistics pulled from GitHub.

• Created a smart watch app using Pebble libraries, AccuWeather API and IBM Watson’s Natural Language Processing API.\n\n • It displays optimal times throughout the day for outdoor activity based on a verbal query made by the user.
• Built this portfolio website from the group up using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. It is hosted on Google\'s App Engine using Python for backend and the domain is secured through Google Domains.
• Built an app using multiple intents, custom classes, listview, checkboxs, radio buttons and a spinner.\n\n • The app enables the user to pass data by saving states in between activites.

• Made a positive impact on the community by constructing educational, social, recreational, and cultural programs.\n\n• Served as a visible campus leader, employee and representative for the Office of Residence Life and Penn State Erie, The Behrend College.
• Assisted students with questions and concerns regarding labs and homework assignments.\n\n• Collaborated with the professor for future assignments.
